title: Using the Observer Agent in iMash
lede: This guide explains how to enable and configure the Observer Agent in iMash to gain real-time insights into live calls, monitor conversation states, and trigger background tools without affecting the primary conversation.

steps.title: Enable the Observer Agent
steps.content:
1. Open your AI Agent configuration.
  2. Go to the Observer Agent tab.
  3. Enable the Observer Agent (disabled by default).

steps.title: Choose a Model for Monitoring
steps.content:
1. Select a model to power the Observer Agent.
  2. You can use higher-latency models that provide more accurate insights, since they run in the background and do not affect the main conversation.

steps.title: Configure MCP for Background Tools
steps.content:
1. Optionally, attach an MCP server to the Observer Agent.
  2. Tools connected here can be triggered silently in the background when certain conditions are met.
  3. These tools run without interrupting the user experience or requiring the main agent to wait for their response.

steps.title: Set Up and Manage Labels
steps.content:
• Predefined labels include: Call Quality Issue, Customer Frustration, Escalation Request, Payment Information, and more.
  • You can also add custom labels, edit existing ones, or disable those not in use.
  • Labels help categorise calls based on detected states during conversations.

steps.title: Monitor Live Calls
steps.content:
1. Go to the Live Calls screen.
  2. Connect to an active call (e.g., through the widget or Avatar interface).
  3. When the Observer Agent detects an event (e.g., user says 'I canâ€™t hear you'), the call will automatically be moved into the appropriate labelled column (e.g., Call Quality Issue).
  4. You can filter by specific labels to focus on important conversations.
